N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 1050.4 - Application of other sources of financial support

State Regulations
(a) A recipient of financial support from the
division shall not substitute such support for other resources available for
use, including but not limited to: (1)

Federal
aid otherwise committed to or intended for use in the program or local
agency; (2)
home relief payments
received on behalf of eligible clients; (3)
health insurance benefits; (4)
revenues derived from the operation of
the program or local agency; and
(5)
revenues committed by a related
organization or corporation. (b) A recipient of financial support shall
cause application for aid under titles IV, XVI, XIX and XX of the Federal

Social Security Law, or any other Federal law to be completed for each eligible
client, and submitted to the appropriate agency for processing. A recipient of
financial support shall render all cooperation as may be necessary to maximize
any potential Federal aid. All information concerning the identity of any
individual, received pursuant to this subdivision, shall be
confidential. (c) Such recipient of
financial support, by the acts of application for an acceptance of such
support, grants to the division full authority to seek, with the approval of
the Director of the Budget, any available Federal aid for substance abuse
services on behalf of that recipient of financial support. The division may
submit claims directly to the appropriate Federal agency or through another

State agency authorized to submit such claims. The recipient of financial
support shall render any assistance, and perform any act which may be required
to make, mature or validate any such claim. Notes
